moduleMetadataJson.name: Microsoft IIS FTP Server LIST Stack Exhaustion
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module triggers Denial of Service condition in the Microsoft Internet
        Information Services (IIS) FTP Server 5.0 through 7.0 via a list (ls) -R command
        containing a wildcard. For this exploit to work in most cases, you need 1) a valid
        ftp account: either read-only or write-access account 2) the "FTP Publishing" must
        be configured as "manual" mode in startup type 3) there must be at least one
        directory under FTP root directory. If your provided an FTP account has write-access
        privilege and there is no single directory, a new directory with random name will be
        created prior to sending exploit payload.
author: Kingcope
Myo Soe

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: RHOSTS
options.description: The target host(s), range CIDR identifier, or hosts file with syntax 'file:<path>'

options.name: SSLVersion
options.description: Specify the version of SSL/TLS to be used (Auto, TLS and SSL23 are auto-negotiate) (Accepted: Auto, TLS, SSL23, SSL3, TLS1, TLS1.1, TLS1.2)

options.name: SSLVerifyMode
options.description: SSL verification method (Accepted: CLIENT_ONCE, FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT, NONE, PEER)

options.name: Proxies
options.description: A proxy chain of format type:host:port[,type:host:port][...]

options.name: ConnectTimeout
options.description: Maximum number of seconds to establish a TCP connection

options.name: TCP::send_delay
options.description: Delays inserted before every send.  (0 = disable)

options.name: FTPPASS
options.description: The password for the specified username

options.name: FTPTimeout
options.description: The number of seconds to wait for a reply from an FTP command

options.name: FTPDEBUG
options.description: Whether or not to print verbose debug statements

options.name: PassiveMode
options.description: Set true for extended passive (EPSV) ftp mode.
